intro: Cracca monanthos, commonly known as the single-flower cracca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas and is known for its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Cracca monanthos is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
